meanings.definition: Diehards: people who strongly resist change or give up easily
meanings.sent1: The diehards at the meeting refused to consider any new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The political diehards held onto their outdated beliefs despite overwhelming evidence.
meanings.sent3: The diehards at the office still use fax machines in the digital age.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like that of diehards clinging to the past.
meanings.sent5: The diehards' resistance to change was as solid as a brick wall.

meanings.definition: Diehards: those who are extremely loyal or devoted to a particular cause or belief
meanings.sent1: The diehards of the fan club never missed a single game.
meanings.sent2: The diehards of the charity worked tirelessly to raise funds for the cause.
meanings.sent3: The diehards of the book club even dressed up as characters for their meetings.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to the company was unwavering, like that of diehards to their favorite team.
meanings.sent5: The diehards' dedication shone brightly like a beacon in the community.
